captions.text: [ WOMAN SPEAKING ARABIC ]
[ SIREN WAILS IN DISTANCE ]
[ SPEAKING ARABIC ]

Amir:
YEAH, MOM HATES ME FIGHTING.
SHE WANTED ME TO RETIRE

AFTER I WON
MY FIRST WORLD TITLE.

SHE SAID,
"YOU WON A WORLD TITLE,
SO YOU SHOULD RETIRE."
I SAID, "I'M ONLY 22."

I GO, "THIS IS JUST THE START
OF MY CAREER."
[ SPEAKING ARABIC ]

Amir: SHE DOESN'T KNOW
HOW THE FIGHT'S GOING

TILL SHE GETS
THAT ONE PHONE CALL.

SO YEAH, IT'S JUST WAITING
FOR THAT ONE PHONE CALL, YEAH.
Falak: I'M REALLY NERVOUS.
[ SIGHS ]

IT DOESN'T MATTER FOR WIN, LOSE.
IT'S ALL RIGHT.

I'M SCARED FOR --
HE'S NOT HURT FOR MY SON.
[ GRUNTING ]
GOOD.
WHAT YOU'RE DOING,

YOU'RE CREATING DECOYS
WITH THE OTHER PUNCHES.
WHEN I JAB, STOP IT.

STEP IN WITH YOUR DECOY JAB
AND A RIGHT HAND.

SEE, GETTING SO CLOSE
TO THE FIGHT NOW,

THE NERVES ARE COMING IN
A LITTLE BIT NOW.

HE'S GOT EVERYTHING
UNDER CONTROL.
IT'S US OUTSIDE.

WE'RE WORSE THAN HE IS,
TO TELL YOU THE TRUTH.
[ GRUNTING ]
THAT'S IT.
THAT'S THE ONE.

Narrator: NO OTHER SPORT JUDGES
A LOSS AS HARSHLY AS BOXING.

FOR THE ONE-TIME
OLYMPIC MEDALIST
AND UNIFIED CHAMPION AMIR KHAN,

SUFFERING HIS SECOND DEFEAT
IN A ROW

MEANT IT WAS TIME
TO RE-EVALUATE.
FIFTH ROUND.

Amir:
YOU KNOW, CHANGING TRAINERS.

I CHANGED FROM FREDDIE ROACH
TO VIRGIL HUNTER.

AND YOU STEP OVER,
AND YOU STAY THERE.

HE'S RIGHT THERE,
LINED UP. SEE?

THIS IS MY FOURTH FIGHT
WITH VIRGIL.

VIRGIL'S TEACHING ME
THE BASICS OF BOXING.

HE'S BROUGHT THAT
BACK INTO ME AGAIN.
[ GRUNTS ]

SEE?
GOOD WORK TODAY, CHAMP.
HE KNOWS HE PUT IN THE WORK.

HE DOESN'T HAVE TO LOOK BACK
AND QUESTION ANYTHING.
THERE'S A PEACE ABOUT YOU.

YEAH,
YOU KNOW YOU'RE READY.

THERE'S ALWAYS A CALM
BEFORE THE STORM.
[ INDISTINCT CONVERSATIONS ]

IT'S ALL YOU, MY MAN.
IT'S ALL YOU.
[ CAMERA SHUTTERS CLICKING ]
SO, I REMEMBER, YOU KNOW,

Shah: THE FIRST DAY
AMIR WALKED INTO THE GYM.

TODAY, LOOK WHERE HE IS,
HE'S HEADLINING AT THE MGM.

Amir: YOU KNOW,
I THOUGHT THE ONLY TIME
I WOULD EVER HEADLINE MGM ARENA

WOULD BE EITHER
AGAINST MANNY PACQUIAO

OR FLOYD MAYWEATHER,
BUT I DID IT BEFORE.

Malignaggi: YOU'RE HELD
IN A VERY HIGH REGARD.

NOBODY ELSE HAS FOUGHT
DEVON ALEXANDER.

GOING INTO THAT FIGHT,
HAS THE PUBLIC SAID,

"OH, THIS IS JUST A PRACTICE
FIGHT FOR SOMETHING BIGGER?"

Amir: IT'S ABOUT ME PUTTING IN
A GREAT PERFORMANCE

AND LOOKING REALLY GOOD
AGAINST DEVON ALEXANDER,

WHICH NOT
MANY FIGHTERS COULD.

I'M GIVEN SO MUCH CONFIDENCE
GOING INTO THIS FIGHT,

KNOWING THAT
I'M THE MAIN ATTRACTION.

TAKE DOWN THE MAYWEATHER PICTURE
AND PUT AMIR KHAN'S PICTURE UP.

I THINK IT WILL BE MUCH BETTER
ON THE MGM ARENA.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

AS I'M GETTING OLDER
AND I'M GETTING WISER,
GETTING SMARTER.

I'M UNDERSTANDING THE SPORT
A LITTLE BIT BETTER.

FOR A YOUNG FIGHTER, YOU KNOW,
IT IS A LOT TO TAKE IN.

IT MAKES ME FEEL
REALLY COMFORTABLE

THAT I KNOW
THAT MY MOM PRAYS OVER ME
AND I'VE GOT HER BLESSINGS.

AND ESPECIALLY
WHEN I'M IN THE RING,

IT'S A VERY LONELY PLACE
WHERE, YOU KNOW, SPIRITUALLY,

EVERY LITTLE THING
DOESN'T HELP YOU.

Man: AND WE WELCOME YOU INSIDE
THE MGM GRAND GARDEN ARENA
HERE IN LAS VEGAS TONIGHT.

Man #2:
AMIR KHAN AND DEVON ALEXANDER

GETTING READY TO FACE OFF
ONE YEAR IN THE MAKING.
Shah: YOU WIN A FIGHT,

IT WILL TAKE YOU TO A HUGE LEVEL
AND HUGE FIGHTS.

WHEN YOU LOSE A FIGHT,
IT CAN TAKE YOU TO NOTHING.

YOU KNOW,
YOU CAN'T EVEN GET A FIGHT.

I MEAN, PEOPLE MIGHT AS WELL
FORGET ABOUT YOU.

AND IF HE WANTS TO
CONTINUE TO BE RECOGNIZED,

IF HE WANTS TO BE
THE MAN IN THE PICTURE,

THIS IS A MAKE-OR-BREAK FIGHT
FOR HIM.
Announcer: FROM BOLTON, ENGLAND,
AMIR "KING" KHAN!
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]

Man: AMIR KHAN HAS TO STAY
IN THE WINNER'S BRACKET

TO BE IN THE MIX
FOR SOMETHING BIG.

Byrd: MR. KHAN...
YES.

MR. ALEXANDER,
LET'S DO THIS.
THIS ALEXANDER WAS TOUGH, MAN.

I MEAN, HE TOOK A LOT OF SHOTS,
WAS GAME.

WE NEVER SEE ALEXANDER
COME FORWARD,

SO YOU COULD SEE
THAT HE WAS HUNGRY.
HE WANTED TO WIN THIS FIGHT.
I WAS SEEING HIS PUNCHES COMING.
I WAS SO FOCUSED

THAT I WAS SEEING EVERYTHING
IN KIND OF SLOW MOTION.
YOU FIND HE'S GONNA THROW A JAB,

BUT WHEN HE THROWS
A STRAIGHT LEFT HAND,

HE'S GONNA COCK IT
A LITTLE BIT.

SO IF I TAKE A LITTLE STEP BACK,
HE'S GONNA REACH WITH IT,
WHICH HE STARTED TO DO.

Man: THAT'S IT!
THAT'S GOOD!
BY THE TIME THE MID ROUNDS COME,

THAT'S WHEN I COULD STEP BACK
AND COUNTER HIM,

YOU KNOW, WHEN HE MISSED ME
BY INCHES.

Malignaggi: YOU STILL GOT TO BE
CAREFUL WITH AMIR'S SPEED,

'CAUSE HE'S JUST LETTING HIS
ARMS JUST FLY AT YOU SO FAST.

I CATCH HIM
WITH SOME GOOD, CLEAN SHOTS.
EVERYTHING'S GOING MY WAY.
I'M GIVING HIM A BEATING,

AND I'M OVERWHELMING HIM
WITH PUNCHING.

I DON'T THINK
HE COULD COPE WITH IT.

Malignaggi:
KHAN IS SO DIFFICULT.

AND I'VE BEEN IN THERE
WITH HIM,

SO I KNOW THE FRUSTRATION
DEVON'S FEELING RIGHT NOW.

Amir: I'M THINKING
HE'S PROBABLY GONNA GIVE UP.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]
BUT NO, HE DIDN'T.

THAT'S WHAT SURPRISED ME
BIG-TIME.

LIKE, HE STILL THOUGHT
HE HAD A CHANCE TO WIN.
HE THOUGHT HE CAN KNOCK ME OUT,

ME BEING THE SO-CALLED GUY WHO
CAN GET KNOCKED OUT BY EVERYONE.

SO HE THOUGHT, "YOU KNOW,
I CAN MAYBE KNOCK HIM OUT,"
BUT HE COULDN'T DO THAT.

HE GAVE IT HIS BEST SHOT.
HE COULDN'T DO THAT.

DOMINATING DEVON ALEXANDER
IS SUCH A STATEMENT.

AMIR KHAN'S FIGHTING AS CLOSE
TO A PERFECT FIGHT AS YOU CAN.
[ BELL DINGS ]

Announcer: LADIES AND GENTLEMEN,
AFTER 12 ROUNDS OF ACTION,

WE HAVE A UNANIMOUS DECISION
IN FAVOR OF THE WINNER,
AMIR "KING" KHAN!
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]
[ INDISTINCT CONVERSATIONS ]
Shah: AFTER THE FIGHT,

AMIR'S MOM WOULD COME OVER
TO THE DRESSING ROOMS
AND MAKE SURE THAT HE'S OKAY.

YOU KNOW, OF COURSE
SHE EXPECTS BRUISES AND STUFF.

OF COURSE.
YOU KNOW WHAT I MEAN?

BUT HE'S HEALTHY.
THAT'S THE MAIN THING.

Woman:
WE'RE WALKING OUT NOW.
[ LAUGHS ]
[ INDISTINCT CONVERSATION ]

Amir: I'M VERY FORTUNATE
TO BE IN A POSITION

WHERE I'VE GOT A LOT OF PEOPLE
THINKING ABOUT ME,
WHERE I'M LIVING.

YOU KNOW, AND THAT'S WHY
I'M COMFORTABLE
AND FINE WITH MY CAREER.

EVEN THOUGH I'VE LOST FIGHTS,
BUT I'VE COME BACK,

AND I'VE BOUNCED BACK
TO THE TOP AGAIN.

IT'S ALL TO DO WITH
PEOPLE PRAYING FOR ME
AND SUPPORTING ME.
[ CHEERS AND APPLAUSE ]
Man: FROM BOLTON, ENGLAND,

A FIGHTER
WHO'S ONLY GETTING BETTER --

A FIGHTER
WHO'S ONLY GETTING BETTER --
AMIR KHAN.

-- Captions by VITAC --
www.vitac.com

comments.text:
All you guys who says khan deserves a shot at either mayweather or Pacquiao 
is full of shit. He got fucked up at 140 ( if you disagree with me the 
facts are in his fights) and he hasn't proven anything at 147. Come back 
when amir has faced elite opponents such as kell brook which khan is scared 
to fight or keith THURMAN, shawn Porter. CUZ fighting chris Algerie is a 
fuckinh joke ﻿
comments.author: mj jm

comments.text:
You're saying Kell brook is elite? He has fought nobody's apart from Shawn 
porter and it seemed like Brook was forced into fighting him to get any 
kind of recognition in the sport. If he didn't have a title right now 
nobody would be even mentioning his name cause he ain't a proven champion 
and has done fuck all in boxing compared to Khan. Khan should fight more 
elite opponents? Khans faced, Peterson, Garcia, Maidana, Barrera, 
Malignaggi, Judah, Mccloskey, Kotelnik, Barrera whereas Kell brook is 
fighting guys like Jo Jo Dan and now Frankie Gavin (these are low calibre 
domestic and European level fighters).... you would of never of thought he 
was IBF champion. Thurman is a good prospect but has yet to prove himself, 
he fought a blown up lightweight in Robert Guerrero (but I still give him 
credit for that fight it was a decent win) and a 40yr old man in Leonard 
Bundu. If people like Victor Ortiz are allowed to face Mayweather why can't 
Khan he has faced many world class opponents and his resume shites over a 
lot of other fighters.

comments.text:
Mayweather wont go near King Khan or Thurman, they are both too good and 
will make him look old and slow, and both could stop him in the late rounds.

Best senario for Mayweather is a Manny Paquiao fight with a rematch clause 
so Mayweather can preserve his precious '0'. Manny is small and past his 
best (still dangerous) but of the 3 Khan, Thurman, Manny you have to think 
that Mayweather will pick Manny. Amir is far too fast, big, strong, and 
young for a 38 year old Mayweather, so is Thurman.

I expect Mayweather v Paquiao for September (if either fights again) and 
Khan v Thurman around the same time. I know which fight I'd rather see, Go 
King Khan!!﻿

comments.author: BoxingFan

comments.text:
Don't be ignorant Amir has moved up to 147lbs and is a far heavier and 
stronger person, in fact he came in the ring at 160lbs vs Alexander, so you 
can't say he he is gonna get knocked out, all the knockdowns he got were at 
a catch weight or at 140lbs where he was weak and weight drained, so we 
have yet to see if he has got real problems with his chin. Also Mayweather 
is no way knocking out Amir, his last Legit TKO, was 8 years ago now 
against Ricky Hatton in 2007. Floyd is not a big puncher and will no way KO 
Khan , oh and Amir has arguably the fastest hands in boxing, and has never 
been outboxed in his professional career so if Amir and Floyd were to fight 
I'd put my money on Amir.

comments.text:
Khan will school Garcia in a rematch at 147 and I aint chatting garbage he 
will. Last I heard Joe Louis got KO'ed by Marciano, Pacquiao got put to

and it's Garcia who seems to have gone backwards struggling against Herrera

for you to comprehend.

comments.text:
Just read a few top comments. Re: Khan vs Mayweather. Khan certainly has 
fast hands but I don't see him troubling Floyd enough to win because Floyd 
moves his head too good for Khan's follow up punches (that connected 
against Alexander). Khan looks more like a flurry puncher, whereas 
Mayweather's ability to pot shot, clinch and duck punches will be too much. 
Although I see both being able to sting each other with fast lead straights 
or hooks.

Nonetheless, Khan is doing his thing. And calling out Mayweather at every 
opportunity is the smart thing to do. Whether it works, well, time will 
only tell.﻿
comments.author: Adam James Emelianenko
